data.title: Eco & Associates, Inc.
data.meta_description: Soil vapor, soil, and groundwater sampling, 	Test pit, trench, borings, and groundwater monitoring well installations, 	Identification of Chemicals of Potential Concern (COPCs), 	Development of Project Plans, Remedial Investigation/Feasibility Study, 	Baseline Human Health Risk Assessment, Ecological Risk Assessment, 	Regulatory agency meetings and presentations, 	Design of Evapo-transpiration (ET) Cap for the landfill, 	Development and maintenance of a comprehensive GIS database for the Site including investigation data, as well as cultural and historical information, 	Proposed Plan, 	Trend Analysis
data.text:
Camp Haan Superfund Site

Riverside, CA

Project Information

Soil vapor, soil, and groundwater sampling

Test pit, trench, borings, and groundwater monitoring well installations

Identification of Chemicals of Potential Concern (COPCs)

Development of Project Plans, Remedial Investigation/Feasibility Study

Baseline Human Health Risk Assessment, Ecological Risk Assessment

Regulatory agency meetings and presentations

Design of Evapo-transpiration (ET) Cap for the landfill

Development and maintenance of a comprehensive GIS database for the Site including investigation data, as well as cultural and historical information

Proposed Plan

Trend Analysis

Camp Haan is a former prisoner of war/troop assembly area located next to March Air Reserve Base, and is part of the USACE Formerly Used Defense Sites (FUDS) Program. Eco & Associates, Inc. conducted a preliminary assessment/site inspection for the 76-acre site. Eco personnel have been involved in the investigations at the Site since 2005.

In March 2007, Eco was selected by the USACE to continue working at Camp Haan, and we are conducting quarterly groundwater sampling.

Site "Y" at the former Camp Haan consists of a former landfill that contained an incinerator and waste and ash associated with the former landfill. Activities conducted at the Site have included the following:

Soil vapor, soil, and groundwater sampling

Test pit, trench, borings, and groundwater monitoring well installations

Identification of Chemicals of Potential Concern (COPCs)

Development of Project Plans, Remedial Investigation/Feasibility Study

Baseline Human Health Risk Assessment, Ecological Risk Assessment

Regulatory agency meetings and presentations

In addition to the above described activities which have been completed or are ongoing, Eco has also recently been tasked with the following:

Design of Evapo-transpiration (ET) Cap for the landfill

Development and maintenance of a comprehensive GIS database for the Site including investigation data, as well as cultural and historical information

Proposed Plan

Trend Analysis

Arvin, CA
